skillTree.localised_description: "I 'ate everyfing - gobbos, da pointy ears, da humies, da spiky gits, and da stunties - I 'ate dem da mostest!"
Tunnel bosses are Greenskins who are good at shoutin’ and hollerin’ at mobs when underground, where space and sight is an issue.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +10 during subterranean intercept battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Bellower’s voice is as deep as it loud, carrying across the battlefield, making sure the boyz are focused on the carnage.
You can’t trust ‘im. E’s a little bit woaah, a little bit Waaagh! Ya know? Well dodgy.
Grimgor fears no injury, but despite his war-ravaged appearance has an unmatched knack for avoiding it.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +2 for Black Orc Big Bosses

enabled_if: Enemy Lord or Hero presence in ability range.

skillTree.localised_description: When a Black Orc’s not-inconsiderable dander is up, you definitely *don’t* want to get in his way!

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +9 for Black Orc units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Black Orc units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Grimgor is bigger 'n' 'arder 'n' betta than orl yoo uvver gits!!!"

effects.description:
Bonus vs Large: +9 for Orc Big 'Uns and Savage Orc Big 'Uns units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +8 for Orc Big 'Uns and Savage Orc Big 'Uns units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Black Orcs are the biggest, strongest, meanest, and most brutal of all Greenskins. Even by those standards, Grimgor is big, strong, mean, and brutal!
"Yoo just pop a couple under yer tongue and 'bosh', everyfing in yer way gets a right royal twattin'!"
Considering he is a complete and utter git, Grimgor's leadership, personal bravery and combat prowess are more than impressive.
"'Arder than 'ard! Dead 'ard!"
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Orc choppas are crude and hefty blades usually swung with violent joy by their owner. A choppa in full swing can have a brutal, crunching impact on the poor fool on the receiving end.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
"Say my name! SAY MY NAME!"
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.
Orcs may be stronger, but Goblins are smarter, nastier, and better-er.

skillTree.localised_description: Greenskin cavalry can be devastating if the myriad mounts can behave. Getting a big stick and maybe a "carrot" in the form of an orange-painted gobbo is the answer!

skillTree.localised_description: This Boss is one with "da boyz", egging the lads on to greater feats and to hit bigga stuff with their choppas.

skillTree.localised_description: Ridin’ on chariots means ya can be even more fighty, an' even more killy!

skillTree.localised_description: Even bigga than a Black Orc, an' not bad at killin’ too!

skillTree.localised_description: This Boss realises the power of "flyin’ fings” and so invests a few teef in making sure his war machines can fling fings really far and really high!

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
A wise Boss knows how to lure the enemy into places where they can be ambushed or trapped with mobs that skulk in the tunnels below.

effects.description: Evasion chance when using the Underway: +6%
Evasion chance when using the Underway: +16%
Evasion chance when using the Underway: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: Raiders are good at marauding through enemy settlements - sending their denizens fleeing as their properties are despoiled.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!
Ravagers are merciless - they will sack an enemy settlement, take everything and kill any that get in their way.
These iron-hard gits are particularly tough and gnarly Greenskins, who - even if wounded - will be up and ready to fight before too long.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for Lords
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: Occasionally an Orc will come along who is more "kunning" than the rest. He quickly rises in ranks as his plans end in victory.
A Boss that has the loyalty of the mobs means he doesn’t have to worry so much about "da boring stuff" like tents and bedding, as they’ll fight for him no matter what.
Being green meanz ya really mean.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Leadership: +12 for Black Orc units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for Black Orcs units
	(Lord's army)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

items.colour_text: The cooling of this armour in the blood of Dwarf Runesmiths has imbued it with great powers – some explosive in nature!

ui_effects.localised_text: ➕ Explosion does not affect friendly troops
